channel.title: attack.t1557.001 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1557.001 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Potential PetitPotam Attack Via EFS RPC Calls
item.description: Detects usage of the windows RPC library Encrypting File System Remote Protocol (MS-EFSRPC). Variations of this RPC are used within the attack refereed to as PetitPotam. The usage of this RPC function should be rare if ever used at all. Thus usage of this function is uncommon enough that any usage of this RPC function should warrant further investigation to determine if it is legitimate. View surrounding logs (within a few minutes before and after) from the Source IP to. Logs from from the Source IP would include dce_rpc, smb_mapping, smb_files, rdp, ntlm, kerberos, etc..'

item.title: ADCSPwn Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by ADCSPwn, a tool to escalate privileges in an active directory network by coercing authenticate from machine accounts and relaying to the certificate service

item.title: WinDivert Driver Load
item.description: Detects the load of the Windiver driver, a powerful user-mode capture/sniffing/modification/blocking/re-injection package for Windows

item.title: SMB Relay Attack Tools
item.description: Detects different hacktools used for relay attacks on Windows for privilege escalation

item.title: RottenPotato Like Attack Pattern
item.description: Detects logon events that have characteristics of events generated during an attack with RottenPotato and the like
